item.title: New focus on Kickstarter: A mouse glove as a replacement for traditional computer mice
item.description: A new Kickstarter project called the “Mouse Glove” aims to revolutionize how we interact with technology, potentially replacing touch screens entirely. Source: Kickstarter website The creators of the Mouse Glove claim their invention offers a more ergonomic and intuitive user experience compared to traditional mice. By promoting a more natural hand position, they believe it can reduce the risk of repetitive strain injuries like carpal tunnel syndrome. The glove replicates standard mouse functionalities, including left and right clicks, scrolling, and cursor control.

item.title: Kickstarter spotlight: TwistVolt, the innovative power strip designer
item.description: While typical power strips only accommodate standard plugs, the TwistVolt sets itself apart. It features built-in USB outlets and a flexible design that allows for twisting and folding to better suit your power needs. Source: Kickstarter website Michael Schroeder, the inventor, explains that their goal was to create a new kind of power strip that prioritizes energy efficiency and provides easy access to all outlets. The result is a product with exceptional energy efficiency, ample USB charging capacity, and a distinctive, patent-pending design that eliminates outlet blockage.

item.title: Some businesses are finding success with crowdfunding
item.description: Crowdfunding, particularly through platforms like Kickstarter, has proven very successful for certain entrepreneurs. The typical project presents a concept and images of the product in development and seeks funding from backers. Both entrepreneurs and their backers can be located anywhere globally. Funding is usually sought through tiered pledges, where higher pledges receive products with additional features. This process is often gamified with “stretch goals,” where exceeding funding targets unlocks new rewards for all backers at specific milestones.

item.title: Kickstarter spotlight: An innovative USB cable that charges smartphones at double the speed
item.description: Minsoo and Emily Seo have developed a USB charging cable, DouBBleTime, that significantly reduces charging times for iPhones and Samsung Galaxy phones compared to standard cables. As explained on their Kickstarter page, typical USB cables attempt to communicate with the connected device while delivering limited power. In contrast, the DouBBleTime cable features a switch that prioritizes charging, effectively decreasing charging time. Source: Kickstarter. The Seos state on their Kickstarter page that a unique chip within the switch communicates with the connected computer, signaling that it only requires charging energy and not data syncing.

item.title: Focus of Kickstarter campaign: Sitting cross-legged on a CrossChair
item.description: Dave McClintock designed a chair that lets you comfortably rest with your legs up. Its unique design is so flexible, it even allows for the sukhasana yoga pose while seated. McClintock explained that the chair caters to millions of workers who experience fatigue, back pain, and stiff muscles from prolonged sitting. While crossing your legs can alleviate these issues, traditional office chairs lack the ergonomics. The CrossChair solves this by enabling various sitting positions, including cross-legged, promoting movement and reducing discomfort.

item.title: Kickstarter's main focus is on recording directly from your phone to the computer
item.description: Recap S2, a compact device designed to connect to smartphones for saving calls to external devices like computers or voice recorders, is seeking funding on Kickstarter. Source: Kickstarter website Inventor Igor Ramos highlights the device’s user-friendliness, stating its compatibility with any device equipped with a combo port for input and a standard stereo microphone port for output. Ramos assures users that Recap recordings maintain the original call quality. A video demonstration is available here.

item.title: Kickstarter spotlight: An improved chair designed to alleviate back discomfort
item.description: Simon Hong, a neuroscientist, is seeking funding for his invention, the Chairbot. This robotic chair aims to eliminate back pain by suggesting new positions to the user based on their current posture. Source: Kickstarter page The Chairbot’s unique design features a split seat that encourages users to alternate between sitting and standing, reducing strain on the spine. Hong explains on the Kickstarter page that this constant shifting prevents the spinal trauma associated with maintaining a single posture for long periods.

item.title: Kickstarter's main focus is the fast Phone Finder
item.description: The Phone Finder helps locate lost smartphones, even if they’re on silent mode, for up to three years. When the Phone Finder device is clicked within 15 meters of the missing phone, the phone will ring, vibrate, and flash, making it easier to find. If the phone is out of range, the Phone Finder website displays its location on a map. Source: Kickstarter Creator Gabsow Tom selected Bluetooth 2.1 for its forward and backward compatibility, allowing the Phone Finder to work with any smartphone, regardless of its iOS or Android version.

item.title: Kickstarter's main focus is the standing desk
item.description: If you need a desk that allows you to work comfortably while standing, Steven Yu might have a solution. His StandDesk is height-adjustable, ranging from 71cm to 114cm, and incorporates design elements that make frequent adjustments easy. Source: Kickstarter. The all-black StandDesk version. “The StandDesk is more than a product; it’s a positive step towards improving people’s lives globally,” Yu stated on his Kickstarter page. An intuitive ‘up/down’ control button effortlessly raises or lowers the desk to the desired height.

item.title: Kickstarter spotlight: Customizable, reusable clothing in an instant
item.description: SiDi Huang, the creator behind ZipSeam, has developed an innovative solution for achieving a tailored look without the need for traditional sewing. ZipSeam offers a quick and easy way to create secure, temporary seams in loose clothing, providing a better fit for the wearer. This invention has a wide range of applications, from the modeling industry and hand-me-downs to simply adjusting the fit of clothes you love. It’s no surprise that this project has garnered significant attention and support.

item.title: The main focus of Kickstarter is iFind, which is powered by ambient electromagnetic radiation
item.description: WeTag’s iFind tags use Bluetooth to connect with iOS or Android devices and don’t require charging. Like similar tracking devices, the tag is attached to an item and located using a smartphone. If the item goes out of range, the ‘Rope’ feature notifies the owner. The ‘UHelp’ feature leverages nearby phones to help find the lost object through Bluetooth. WeTag highlights a unique feature: shaking the iFind tag will cause the paired phone to vibrate.

item.title: Concentrating on Kickstarter: Making Solar Power Accessible to Everyone
item.description: Spor Solar Charges aims to make convenient solar-powered battery charging accessible to everyone. Their product, Spor, is a portable battery charger for USB devices that can recharge itself using solar energy. It can also be powered up using a standard AC outlet. The company claims that Spor can charge multiple devices simultaneously and replenish a phone’s battery almost as quickly as a wall outlet, according to their Kickstarter page. Source: Kickstarter.
